abstract: Returns a dictionary that describes the POSIX attributes of the file specified at a given.

declaration.code: func fileAttributes(atPath path: String, traverseLink yorn: Bool) -> [AnyHashable : Any]?

overview:
## Return Value

An `NSDictionary` object that describes the POSIX attributes of the file specified at `path`. The keys in the dictionary are described in `File Attribute Keys`. If there is no item at `path`, returns `nil`.

## Discussion

This code example gets several attributes of a file and logs them.

As a convenience, `NSDictionary` provides a set of methods (declared as a category in `NSFileManager.h`) for quickly and efficiently obtaining attribute information from the returned dictionary: [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileGroupOwnerAccountName()], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileModificationDate()], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileOwnerAccountName()], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/filePosixPermissions()], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileSize()], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileSystemFileNumber()], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileSystemNumber()], and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/fileType()]. For example, you could rewrite the file modification statement in the code example above as:

### Special Considerations

Because this method does not return error information, it has been deprecated as of OS X v10.5. Use [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FileManager/attributesOfItem(atPath:)] instead.

items.description: Returns the attributes of the item at a given path.
items.name: attributesOfItem(atPath:)

items.description: Sets the attributes of the specified file or directory.
items.name: setAttributes(_:ofItemAtPath:)

items.description: Changes the attributes of a given file or directory.
items.name: changeFileAttributes(_:atPath:)

items.description: Returns a dictionary that describes the attributes of the mounted file system on which a given path resides.
items.name: fileSystemAttributes(atPath:)

items.description: Returns the directories and files (including symbolic links) contained in a given directory.
items.name: directoryContents(atPath:)

items.description: Creates a directory (without contents) at a given path with given attributes.
items.name: createDirectory(atPath:attributes:)

items.description: Creates a symbolic link identified by a given path that refers to a given location.
items.name: createSymbolicLink(atPath:pathContent:)

items.description: Returns the path of the directory or file that a symbolic link at a given path refers to.
items.name: pathContentOfSymbolicLink(atPath:)

items.description: An `NSFileManager` object sends this message to its handler for each error it encounters when copying, moving, removing, or linking files or directories.
items.name: fileManager(_:shouldProceedAfterError:)

items.description: An `NSFileManager` object sends this message to a handler immediately before attempting to move, copy, rename, or delete, or before attempting to link to a given path.
items.name: fileManager(_:willProcessPath:)

items.description: Replaces the contents of the item at the specified URL in a manner that ensures no data loss occurs.
items.name: replaceItemAtURL(originalItemURL:withItemAtURL:backupItemName:options:)
